com.chaining

Class Condition<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.chaining.Condition<T>

  • public class Condition<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    a function that will not execute the Consumer passed to the then(Consumer) until the Predicate passed to it returned true, else it will change nothing

    Created by Ahmed Adel Ismail on 10/29/2017.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Chain<T> invoke(io.reactivex.functions.Action action)
      invoke the passed action if the Predicate returned true, usually this is done for side-effects
      Chain<T> then(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T> action)
      invoke the passed action if the Predicate returned true
      <R> Optional<R> thenMap(io.reactivex.functions.Function<T,R> mapper)
      invoke the passed action based on the previous Predicate result, this action will cause the item stored to be changed to the expected type (it will return a new Optional holding the mapping result)
      <R> Optional<R> thenTo(java.util.concurrent.Callable<R> itemCallable)
      convert to an Optional containing the result of the passed Callable based on the previous Predicate result
      <R> Optional<R> thenTo(R item)
      convert to an Optional containing the passed item based on the previous Predicate result

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • then

        public Chain<T> then(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T> action)
        invoke the passed action if the Predicate returned true
        Parameters:
        action - the action to update the current Object
        Returns:
        the Chain with the updated state (if the Predicate returned true, or will return it with no updates

      • invoke

        @SideEffect(value="usually this operation is done for side-effects")
public Chain<T> invoke(io.reactivex.functions.Action action)
        invoke the passed action if the Predicate returned true, usually this is done for side-effects
        Parameters:
        action - the action to execute
        Returns:
        the Chain with the updated state (if the Predicate returned true, or will return it with no updates

      • thenMap

        public <R> Optional<R> thenMap(io.reactivex.functions.Function<T,R> mapper)
        invoke the passed action based on the previous Predicate result, this action will cause the item stored to be changed to the expected type (it will return a new Optional holding the mapping result)
        Parameters:
        mapper - the action to convert the current item into a new item
        Returns:
        the Optional with the updated state based on the previous Predicate

      • thenTo

        public <R> Optional<R> thenTo(@NonNull
                              R item)
        convert to an Optional containing the passed item based on the previous Predicate result
        Parameters:
        item - an item to be the root for the new Optional
        Returns:
        a new Optional

      • thenTo

        public <R> Optional<R> thenTo(@NonNull
                              java.util.concurrent.Callable<R> itemCallable)
        convert to an Optional containing the result of the passed Callable based on the previous Predicate result
        Parameters:
        itemCallable - a Callable that will return an item to be the root for the new Optional
        Returns:
        a new Optional
